section.para: There are no forethought logical connections between tenses allowed by the grammar, to keep tenses simpler. Nor is there any way to override simple left-grouping of the connectives, the Lojban default.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi puza bi'o bazu vasxu
interlinear-gloss.en: I breathe from a medium time ago till a long time to come.

section.para: (It is to be hoped that I have a long life ahead of me.)
One additional use of non-logical connectives within tenses is discussed in . Other uses will probably be identified in future.

section.title: 21. Sub-events
section.para: Another application of non-logical tense connection is to talk about sub-events of events. Consider a six-shooter: a gun which can fire six bullets in succession before reloading. If I fire off the entire magazine twice, I can express the fact in Lojban thus:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi reroi pi'u xaroi cecla le seldanti
interlinear-gloss.en: On two occasions, I fire the gun six times.

section.para:
It would be confusing, though grammatical, to run the reroiand the xaroidirectly together. However, the non-logical connective pi'uexpresses a Cartesian product (also known as a cross product) of two sets. In this case, there is a set of two firings each of which is represented by a set of six shots, for twelve shots in all (hence the name
pi'u
cross product
Cartesian product product: the product of 2 and 6 is 12). Its use specifies very precisely what occurs.
In fact, you can specify strings of interval properties and event contours within a single tense without the use of a logical or non-logical connective cmavo. This allows tenses of the type:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la djordj. ca'o co'a ciska
interlinear-gloss.en: George continues to start to write.
interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi reroi ca'o xaroi darxi le damri
interlinear-gloss.en: On two occasions, I continue to beat the drum six times.

section.title: 22. Conversion of sumti tcita: JAI
section.para: The following cmavo are discussed in this section:
Conversion is the regular Lojban process of moving around the places of a place structure. The cmavo of selma'o SE serve this purpose, exchanging the first place with one of the others:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi cu klama le zarci
interlinear-gloss.en: I go-to the market.
interlinear-gloss.jbo: le zarci cu se klama mi
interlinear-gloss.en: The market is-gone-to by-me.

section.para: It is also possible to bring a place that is specified by a sumti tcita (for the purposes of this chapter, a tense sumti tcita) to the front, by using jaiplus the tense as the grammatical equivalent of SE:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le ratcu cu citka le cirla vi le panka
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The rat eats the cheese [short distance] the park.
interlinear-gloss.en: The rat eats the cheese in the park.
interlinear-gloss.jbo: le panka cu jai vi citka le cirla fai le ratcu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The park is-the-place-of eating the cheese by-the rat.
interlinear-gloss.en: The park is where the rat eats the cheese.

section.para: In , the construction JAI+tense converts the location sumti into the first place. The previous first place has nowhere to go, since the location sumti is not a numbered place; however, it can be inserted back into the bridi with fai, the indefinite member of selma'o FA.
(The other members of FA are used to mark the first, second, etc. places of a bridi explicitly:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: fa mi cu klama fe le zarci

section.para: means the same as

interlinear-gloss.jbo: fe le zarci cu klama fa mi

section.para: as well as the simple

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi cu klama le zarci

section.para: in which the place structure is determined by position.)
Like SE conversion, JAI+tense conversion is especially useful in descriptions with LE selma'o:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi viska le jai vi citka be le cirla
interlinear-gloss.en: I saw the place-of eating the cheese.

section.para: Here the eater of the cheese is elided, so no faiappears.
Of course, temporal tenses are also usable with JAI:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi djuno fi le jai ca morsi be fai la djan.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I know about the [present] is-dead of-the-one-called John.
I know the time of John's death.
interlinear-gloss.en: I know when John died.

section.title: 23. Tenses versus modals
section.para: Grammatically, every use of tenses seen so far is exactly paralleled by some use of modals as explained in . Modals and tenses alike can be followed by sumti, can appear before the selbri, can be used in pure and mixed connections, can participate in JAI conversions. The parallelism is perfect. However, there is a deep difference in the semantics of tense constructs and modal constructs, grounded in historical differences between the two forms. Originally, modals and tenses were utterly different things in earlier versions of Loglan; only in Lojban have they become grammatically interchangeable. And even now, differences in semantics continue to be maintained.
The core distinction is that whereas the modal bridi

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi nelci do mu'i le nu do nelci mi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I like you with-motivation the event-of you like me.
interlinear-gloss.en: I like you because you like me.

section.para: places the le nusumti in the x1 place of the gismu mukti(which underlies the modal mu'i), namely the motivating event, the tensed bridi

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi nelci do ba le nu do nelci mi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I like you after the event-of you like me.
interlinear-gloss.en: I like you after you like me.

section.para: places the le nusumti in the x2 place of the gismu balvi(which underlies the tense ba), namely the point of reference for the future tense. Paraphrases of and , employing the brivla muktiand balviexplicitly, would be:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le nu do nelci mi cu mukti le nu mi nelci do
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The event-of you like me motivates the event-of I like you.
interlinear-gloss.en: Your liking me is the motive for my liking you.

section.para: and

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le nu mi nelci do cu balvi le nu do nelci mi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The event-of I like you is after the event of you like me.
interlinear-gloss.en: My liking you follows (in time) your liking me.

section.para: As a result, the afterthought sentence-connective forms of and are, respectively:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi nelci do .imu'ibo do nelci mi
interlinear-gloss.en: I like you. [That is] Because you like me.
interlinear-gloss.jbo: do nelci mi .ibabo mi nelci do
interlinear-gloss.en: You like me. Afterward, I like you.

section.para: In , the order of the two bridi mi nelci doand do nelci miis the same as in . In , however, the order is reversed: the origin point do nelci miphysically appears before the future-time event mi nelci do. section.title: 24. Tense questions: cu'e
section.para: The following cmavo is discussed in this section:

There are two main ways to ask questions about tense. The main English tense question words are When?and Where?. These may be paraphrased respectively as At what time?and At what place?In these forms, their Lojban equivalents simply involve a tense plus ma, the Lojban sumti question:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do klama le zdani ca ma
interlinear-gloss.gloss: You go to the house at what time?
interlinear-gloss.en: When do you go to the house?
interlinear-gloss.jbo: le verba vi ma pu cadzu le bisli
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The child [short space] [what sumti?] [past] walks-on the ice.
The child at/near what place walked on the ice?
interlinear-gloss.en: Where did the child walk on the ice?

section.para: There is also a non-specific tense and modal question, cu'e, belonging to selma'o CUhE. This can be used wherever a tense or modal construct can be used.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le nanmu cu'e batci le gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The man [what tense?] bites the dog.
interlinear-gloss.en: When/Where/How does the man bite the dog?

section.para: Possible answers to might be:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: va
interlinear-gloss.en: Some ways from here.
interlinear-gloss.jbo: puzu
interlinear-gloss.en: A long time ago.
interlinear-gloss.jbo: vi le lunra
interlinear-gloss.en: On the moon.
interlinear-gloss.jbo: pu'o
interlinear-gloss.en: He hasn't yet done so.

section.para: or even the modal reply (from selma'o BAI; see ):

interlinear-gloss.jbo: seka'a le briju
interlinear-gloss.en: With-destination the office.

section.para: The only way to combine cu'ewith other tense cmavo is through logical connection, which makes a question that pre-specifies some information:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do puzi je cu'e sombo le gurni
interlinear-gloss.en: You sowed the grain a little while ago; when else do you sow it?

section.para: Additionally, the logical connective itself can be replaced by a question word:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la .artr. pu je'i ba nolraitru
interlinear-gloss.en: Was Arthur a king or will he be?

section.para: Answers to would be logical connectives such as je, meaning both, najemeaning the latter, or jenaimeaning the former.

section.title: 25. Explicit magnitudes
section.para: It is a limitation of the VA and ZI system of specifying magnitudes that they can only prescribe vague magnitudes: small, medium, or large. In order to express both an origin point and an exact distance, the Lojban construction called a termsetis employed. (Termsets are explained further in and .) It is grammatical for a termset to be placed after a tense or modal tag rather than a sumti, which allows both the origin of the imaginary journey and its distance to be specified. Here is an example:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la frank. sanli zu'a nu'i la djordj.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: la'u lo mitre be li mu [nu'u]
interlinear-gloss.en: Frank is standing five meters to the left of George.

section.para: Here the termset extends from the nu'ito the implicit nu'uat the end of the sentence, and includes the terms la djordj., which is the unmarked origin point, and the tagged sumti lo mitre be li mu, which the cmavo la'u(of selma'o BAI, and meaning with quantity; see ) marks as a quantity. Both terms are governed by the tag zu'a

It is not necessary to have both an origin point and an explicit magnitude: a termset may have only a single term in it. A less precise version of
magnitude
magnitude explicit magnitude
magnitude is:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la frank. sanli zu'a nu'i la'u
interlinear-gloss.en: Frank stands five meters to the left.
